adjective.description: Having a (usually pleasant) flavour or odour; appetizing, fragrant.
Figurative. That is relished or enjoyed; able to be savoured; delightful.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Geoffrey Chaucer (c1340–1400), poet and administrator. From Middle French saverous, savorous (French savoureux) delicious, flavoursome, (of a woman's mouth or kiss) delightful, sweet, tempting (both 1200 in Old French) from post-classical Latin saporosus.
